title: book_Forgotten_New_York
text:
ISBN-13: 9780060754006.
ISBN-10: 0060754001.
Title: Forgotten New York.
Subtitle: Views of a Lost Metropolis.
Authors: Kevin Walsh.
Categories: Travel.
Thumbnail: http://books.google.com/books/content?id=77aiRf018Y0C&printsec=frontcover&img=1&zoom=1&source=gbs_api.
Description: Forgotten New York is your passport to more than 300 years of history, architecture, and memories hidden in plain sight. Houses dating to the first Dutch settlers on Staten Island; yellow brick roads in Brooklyn; clocks embedded in the sidewalk in Manhattan; bishop's crook lampposts in Queens; and a white elephant in the Bronxâ€”this is New York and this is your guide to seeing it all. Forgotten New York covers all five boroughs with easy-to-use maps and suggested routes to hundreds of out-of-the way places, antiquated monuments, streets to nowhere, and buildings from a time lost. Forgotten New York features: Quiet Places Truly Forgotten History Happened Here What Is This Thing? Forgotten People And so much more.
Published Year: 2006.
Average Rating: 4.18.
Number of Pages: 384.
Ratings Count: 198.
